content:
Int32Rect Struct

In this Article

Describes the width, height, and location of an integer rectangle.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter(typeof(System.Windows.Int32RectConverter))]
[System.Windows.Markup.ValueSerializer(typeof(System.Windows.Converters.Int32RectValueSerializer))]
public struct Int32Rect : IFormattable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.ValueType
  • Int32Rect

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="X,Y,Width,Height"/>  
- or   
<object property="Empty"/>

XAML Values

X

System.Int32

The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

Y

System.Int32

The y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

Width

System.Int32

The width of the rectangle.

Height

System.Int32

The height of the rectangle.

XAML Text Usage

You can also use whitespace instead of commas to delimit values. Whitespace can also be used with a comma delimited value set.

Constructors summary

Int32Rect(Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32)

Initializes a new instance of an Int32Rect with the specified stem.Windows.Int32Rect.X* and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Y* coordinates and the specified stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Width* and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*.

Properties summary

Empty

Gets the empty rectangle, a special value that represents a rectangle with no position or area.
HasArea

Gets a value that indicates whether the stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Width* and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Height* properties of the Int32Rect are greater than 0.
Height

Gets or sets the height of the rectangle.
IsEmpty

Gets a value indicating whether the rectangle is empty.
Width

Gets or sets the width of the rectangle.
X

Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
Y

Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

Methods summary

Equals(Object)

Determines whether the specified rectangle is equal to this rectangle.
Equals(Int32Rect)

Determines whether the specified rectangle is equal to this rectangle.
Equals(Int32Rect,Int32Rect)

Determines whether the specified rectangles are equal.
GetHashCode()

Creates a hash code from this rectangle's stem.Windows.Int32Rect.X*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*, and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Height* values.
Parse(String)

Creates an Int32Rect structure from the specified String representation.
ToString()

Creates a string representation of this Int32Rect.
ToString(IFormatProvider)

Creates a string representation of this Int32Rect based on the supplied IFormatProvider.

Operators summary

op_Equality(Int32Rect,Int32Rect)

Compares two rectangles for exact equality.
op_Inequality(Int32Rect,Int32Rect)

Compares two rectangles for inequality.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IFormattable.ToString(String,IFormatProvider)

Formats the value of the current instance using the specified format.

Constructors

  • Int32Rect(Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32)

    Initializes a new instance of an Int32Rect with the specified stem.Windows.Int32Rect.X* and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Y* coordinates and the specified stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Width* and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*.

    public Int32Rect (int x, int y, int width, int height);

    Parameters

    • x
      Int32

      The stem.Windows.Int32Rect.X* of the new Int32Rect instance which specifies the x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

    • y
      Int32

      The stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Y* of the new Int32Rect instance which specifies the y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

    • width
      Int32

      The stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Width* of the new Int32Rect instance which specifies the width of the rectangle.

    • height
      Int32

      The stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Height* of the new Int32Rect instance which specifies the height of the rectangle.

Properties

  • Empty

    Gets the empty rectangle, a special value that represents a rectangle with no position or area.

    public static System.Windows.Int32Rect Empty { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32Rect

      An empty rectangle with no position or area.

    Remarks

    This property is the same as calling the constructor using 0 for all parameter values.

    XAML Attribute Usage

    <object property="Empty" />

    XAML Values

    property
    A property that accepts a Int32Rect value.

  • HasArea

    Gets a value that indicates whether the stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Width* and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Height* properties of the Int32Rect are greater than 0.

    public bool HasArea { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Width* and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Height* properties of the Int32Rect are greater than 0; otherwise, false.

  • Height

    Gets or sets the height of the rectangle.

    public int Height { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The height of the rectangle. The default value is 0.

  • IsEmpty

    Gets a value indicating whether the rectangle is empty.

    public bool IsEmpty { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the rectangle is empty; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

  • Width

    Gets or sets the width of the rectangle.

    public int Width { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The width of the rectangle. The default value is 0.

  • X

    Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

    public int X { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle. The default value is 0.

  • Y

    Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

    public int Y { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle. The default value is 0.

Methods

  • Equals(Object)

    Determines whether the specified rectangle is equal to this rectangle.

    public override bool Equals (object o);

    Parameters

    • o
      Object

      The object to compare to the current rectangle.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if o is an Int32Rect and the same stem.Windows.Int32Rect.X*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*, and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Height* as this rectangle; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This operation tests for object equality.

  • Equals(Int32Rect)

    Determines whether the specified rectangle is equal to this rectangle.

    public bool Equals (System.Windows.Int32Rect value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Int32Rect

      The rectangle to compare to the current rectangle.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if both rectangles have the same stem.Windows.Int32Rect.X*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*, and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Height* as this rectangle; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This operation tests for object equality.

  • Equals(Int32Rect,Int32Rect)

    Determines whether the specified rectangles are equal.

    public static bool Equals (System.Windows.Int32Rect int32Rect1, System.Windows.Int32Rect int32Rect2);

    Parameters

    • int32Rect1
      Int32Rect

      The first rectangle to compare.

    • int32Rect2
      Int32Rect

      The second rectangle to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if int32Rect1 and int32Rect2 have the same stem.Windows.Int32Rect.X*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*, and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This operation tests for object equality.

  • GetHashCode()

    Creates a hash code from this rectangle's stem.Windows.Int32Rect.X*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*, and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Height* values.

    public override int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      This rectangle's hash code.

  • Parse(String)

    Creates an Int32Rect structure from the specified String representation.

    public static System.Windows.Int32Rect Parse (string source);

    Parameters

    • source
      String

      A string representation of an Int32Rect.

    Returns

    • Int32Rect

      The equivalent Int32Rect structure.

  • ToString()

    Creates a string representation of this Int32Rect.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A string containing the same stem.Windows.Int32Rect.X*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*, and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Height* values of this Int32Rect structure.

  • ToString(IFormatProvider)

    Creates a string representation of this Int32Rect based on the supplied IFormatProvider.

    public string ToString (IFormatProvider provider);

    Parameters

    • provider
      IFormatProvider

      The format provider to use. If provider is null, the current culture is used.

    Returns

    • String

      A string representation of this instance of Int32Rect.

Operators

  • op_Equality(Int32Rect,Int32Rect)

    Compares two rectangles for exact equality.

    public static bool op_Equality (System.Windows.Int32Rect int32Rect1, System.Windows.Int32Rect int32Rect2);

    Parameters

    • int32Rect1
      Int32Rect

      The first rectangle to compare.

    • int32Rect2
      Int32Rect

      The second rectangle to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if int32Rect1 and int32Rect2 have the same stem.Windows.Int32Rect.X*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*, and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*; otherwise, false.

  • op_Inequality(Int32Rect,Int32Rect)

    Compares two rectangles for inequality.

    public static bool op_Inequality (System.Windows.Int32Rect int32Rect1, System.Windows.Int32Rect int32Rect2);

    Parameters

    • int32Rect1
      Int32Rect

      The first rectangle to compare.

    • int32Rect2
      Int32Rect

      The second rectangle to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      false if int32Rect1 and int32Rect2 have the same stem.Windows.Int32Rect.X*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Y*, stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Width*, and stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Height*; otherwise, if all of these values are the same, then true.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • IFormattable.ToString(String,IFormatProvider)

    Formats the value of the current instance using the specified format.

    string IFormattable.ToString (string format, IFormatProvider provider);

    Parameters

    • format
      String

      The format to use.

    • provider
      IFormatProvider

      The provider to use to format the value

    Returns

    • String

      The value of the current instance in the specified format.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the Int32Rect instance is cast to an IFormattable interface.
